laboratory_examinations.findings: Compound heterozygous variants in the FREM1 gene (c.247 C>T; p.His83Tyr and g.14,769,868 InsA) on chromosome 9p22.3. The missense variant in exon 4 and splice site variant in intron 27 were predicted to be damaging. Both variants were absent in all public databases.
Confirmed perfect segregation of the identified variant within the family.
